result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J Hohm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eric J Hohm

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Comply with any mental health / psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Attend 2 self-help meetins per week. Attend Criminal Thinking and Cognitive Thinking courses.

No Contact with anyone listed in the criminal complaints or any co-defendants. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time. Sentence credit of 289 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Case 15CF1354
Costs previously imposed were converted to a civil judgment.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 11/23/16 Plea and sentencing transcript. Filed by Cheryl Humpal.

Defendant Eric J Hohm in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called along with Defendant's open cases of 16CF457 & 15CF1354. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Martinez makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT #1

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

_____9 MONTHS JAIL, STRAIGHT TIME (CREDIT - 289 days) ***CONCURRENT TO 15CF1354***

Any outstanding costs to be converted to Civil Judgment
(Fax) Dated 11/15/16, from Atty Martinez to Judge Carter, requesting all of the Defendant's cases get set for plea/sentencing tomorrow.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric J Hohm in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes statements regarding sentencing.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR     **CONCURRENT**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with:  anyone listed in criminal complaints or any Co-Defendants 
____Criminal Thinking course, Cognitive Thinking course
____2 self-help meetings per week  
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

COSTS:  $253.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant Eric J Hohm in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Juech states that they are not prepared to proceed for sentencing as there is a request by a victim on one of the cases to appear. Court adjourns. Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Addendume to PSI. Filed by Agent Domrose.
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Eric J Hohm in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State realizes that Probation and Parole did not address Defendant's 3rd case on their sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Weathers requests that cases proceed anyway today to sentencing.  Court refers back to presentence investigator to address Case #15CM154.   Court reschedules.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on June 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
